page.title: 07ROWSLEY
page.content: and passers-by. Rowsley used to have a railway station,situated to the east of Rowsley Bridge. The station was converted to Rowsley Garage (now derelict) when the railway was demolished in 1968. Next door to the old station there used to be an Express Dairy Milk terminal, now used by Bakewell Potteries. The potteries sell all their products in nearby shops. The festival each June includes well dressing. The now disused wells are intricately decorated with flowers petals and a memrial service held at each.The festival also includes considerable display of local crafts and talents. The is a parade and Morris dancing, and maypole dancing, and exhibition of Childrens work.
